nealrichardson commented on a change in pull request #9618:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9618#discussion_r585902139



##########
File path: r/R/dataset-write.R
##########
@@ -56,11 +56,12 @@
 #' @export
 write_dataset <- function(dataset,
                           path,
-                          format = dataset$format,
+                          format = c("parquet", "feather", "arrow", "ipc"),

Review comment:
       Need to update the docs to reflect the new behavior. You may (also) want to borrow the language used to describe `format` from `dataset-format.R`.

##########
File path: r/tests/testthat/test-dataset.R
##########
@@ -1061,6 +1061,17 @@ test_that("Writing a dataset: Parquet->Parquet (default)", {
   )
 })
 
+test_that("Writing a dataset: Not specified format", {
+  skip_on_os("windows") # https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9651
+  dst_dir <- make_temp_dir()
+  write_dataset(mtcars, dst_dir)
+  new_ds <- open_dataset(dst_dir)

Review comment:
       FWIW the default format for open_dataset() is parquet, so this test would have failed if it hadn't written parquet files.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
I'd like to use the R package interface to access data distributed in a tab-separated text file that is much larger than available RAM.  I understand that in principle this is possible using `open_datatset()` in text mode and then streaming data out to parquet via `write_dataset()`, but this strategy fails even on small text files with an unexpected error:

Here's a minimal reproducible example.

 
fs::dir_create("import_dir")
readr::write_tsv(mtcars, "import_dir/mtcars.tsv")
ds <- arrow::open_dataset("import_dir", format="text", delim="\t")
arrow::write_dataset(ds, "parquet_dir")
The error I get occurs only on the last line (`write_dataset()`), saying: 
Error in options$update(...) : attempt to apply non-function
fields.summary: [R] write_dataset "format" argument default and validation could be better
fields.environment:
R 4.0.3, Ubuntu 20.04.

sessionInfo():



> sessionInfo()
R version 4.0.3 (2020-10-10)
Platform: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu (64-bit)
Running under: Ubuntu 20.04 LTS

Matrix products: default
BLAS/LAPACK: /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/openblas-pthread/libopenblasp-r0.3.8.so

locale:
 [1] LC_CTYPE=en_US.UTF-8       LC_NUMERIC=C               LC_TIME=en_US.UTF-8        LC_COLLATE=en_US.UTF-8    
 [5] LC_MONETARY=en_US.UTF-8    LC_MESSAGES=C              LC_PAPER=en_US.UTF-8       LC_NAME=C                 
 [9] LC_ADDRESS=C               LC_TELEPHONE=C             LC_MEASUREMENT=en_US.UTF-8 LC_IDENTIFICATION=C       

attached base packages:
[1] stats     graphics  grDevices utils     datasets  methods   base     

loaded via a namespace (and not attached):
 [1] rstudioapi_0.13   magrittr_2.0.1    hms_0.5.3         tidyselect_1.1.0  bit_4.0.4         R6_2.5.0          rlang_0.4.9      
 [8] dplyr_1.0.2       tools_4.0.3       R.oo_1.24.0       arrow_2.0.0       DBI_1.1.0         ellipsis_0.3.1    bit64_4.0.5      
[15] assertthat_0.2.1  tibble_3.0.4      lifecycle_0.2.0   crayon_1.3.4      readr_1.4.0       purrr_0.3.4       arkdb_0.0.8      
[22] duckdb_0.2.4      fs_1.5.0          vctrs_0.3.5       R.utils_2.10.1    curl_4.3          glue_1.4.2        compiler_4.0.3   
[29] pillar_1.4.7      generics_0.1.0    R.methodsS3_1.8.1 pkgconfig_2.0.3

comments.body:
If you want to write to parquet, you need to specify {{format = "parquet"}} in the write_dataset() call: https://arrow.apache.org/docs/r/reference/write_dataset.html

We'll fix the error handling here since that was not a useful error message to get.

Thanks, that makes total sense.  Works great with the toy example, trying a larger dataset now.  Again, really excited about this possibility, we'll see what the benchmarks look like!

 

Just a few related but very minor notes on this workflow:

- Looks like the open_dataset() file path doesn't understand symlinks (which is a bit more annoying than usual given the requirement that the data files are all in their own dir)

- Looks like the "text" format does not support gzipped text files (this is a gotcha since R connection() and thus most standard functions, like read.csv() or read_csv(), can take a gzipped file and decompress streaming). Not sure if that qualifies for a separate issue?

- It would be sweet if write_dataset() could merely fall back on a valid format rather than throwing an error message?

Some notes:

* For this issue, IMO we should change the default arg for {{format = c("parquet", "feather", "arrow", "ipc")}} (the latter three all being aliases of the same thing, for compatibility elsewhere in the code) and let {{match.arg()}} handle our validation.
* [~cboettig] do you have a reprex for open_dataset() not working with symlinks? I was working with a symlinked dataset last week and it was fine.
* Regarding compressed CSV datasets, we have ARROW-10372 for that. Agreed it would be nice.
* We'll also make it so you can open_dataset() on a single file or list of files, not just a whole directory. ARROW-9657 should cover that.
